ACT
17
Great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers
A decedent who left no descendants or parents, nor did they leave any descendants, nor a spouse, nor grandparents, nor did they leave any descendants, his great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers inherit.
One half is inherited by the great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers on the father's side, and the other half is inherited by the great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers on the mother's side.
